review.title: Texture Classification Approach Based on Combination of Edge & Co-occurrence and Local Binary Pattern
review.abstract: texture classification is one of the problems which has been paid very much attention on people by computer scientists all since late 90s. if texture classification is done correctly and accurately, it can be used in many cases such as pattern recognition, object detail tracking, and shape recognition. so far, there have been so many methods offered to solve this problem. near all these methods have tried to extract and define features to can separate even different labels of textures really well. this article has offered too an approach which has an overall process on the images of textures based on local binary pattern and gray level co - occurrence matrix and then by edge detection, and quite finally, extracting the statistical features from the images would classify them. although, this approach is a general one and is could be used in different applications, locally the method has been tested on the stone texture and the results have been dramatically compared with some of the previous approaches to prove the quality of proposed approach.

metadata.abstractText: Texture classification is one of the problems which has been paid much attention on by computer scientists since late 90s. If texture classification is done correctly and accurately, it can be used in many cases such as Pattern recognition, object tracking, and shape recognition. So far, there have been so many methods offered to solve this problem. Near all these methods have tried to extract and define features to separate different labels of textures really well. This article has offered an approach which has an overall process on the images of textures based on Local binary pattern and Gray Level Co-occurrence matrix and then by edge detection, and finally, extracting the statistical features from the images would classify them. Although, this approach is a general one and is could be used in different applications, the method has been tested on the stone texture and the results have been compared with some of the previous approaches to prove the quality of proposed approach. Keywords-Texture Classification, Gray level Co occurrence, Local Binary Pattern, Statistical Features
